articles.author: Maya Gebeily, James Mackenzie, John Irish
articles.description: The Paris conference aims to mobilise both humanitarian aid and support for the Lebanese military.
articles.title: Israeli strike kills Lebanese troops as France rallies support for army

articles.author: Shoon Naing, Wa Lone, Devjyot Ghoshal, Poppy Mcpherson, Antoni Slodkowski
articles.description: When an alliance led by three rebel armies seized swathes of territory near Myanmar's border with China from the military junta last October, Beijing looked the other way.
articles.title: How an anxious China is backing Myanmar's faltering junta in civil war

articles.author: James Redmayne, Alasdair Pal
articles.description: The demand for Britain to pay reparations or make other amends for transatlantic slavery is a long-standing one, but has recently gained momentum, particularly among the Caribbean Community and the African Union.
articles.title: King Charles acknowledges Commonwealth's 'painful' history with slavery on summit agenda

articles.author: Francesco Guarascio, Phuong Nguyen
articles.description: Vietnam is ready to work with BRICS, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh said as he attended the group's summit for the first time this week and held meetings with Chinese and Russian leaders.
articles.title: PM Chinh says Vietnam to work with BRICS as he meets with China, Russia leaders

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 10,000 people in Haiti have been internally displaced in the last week as armed gangs operating in and around the capital Port-au-Prince ramp up attacks on areas they do not yet control, according U.N. migration agency estimates on Thursday.
articles.title: More than 10,000 Haitians flee gang attacks in past week, UN says

articles.author: Tim Kelly
articles.description: Japan's voters could end more than a decade of Liberal Democratic Party dominance on Sunday, forcing the ruling party into power-sharing deals that could undermine the country's leadership.
articles.title: Japan election to test ruling party, may bring uncertainty

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The World Bank announced on Thursday a new gender strategy aimed at boosting economic opportunities for women and enabling their participation in the global economy through social protection and access to broadband and capital.
articles.title: World Bank rolls out new strategy to boost economic opportunities for women

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indonesia has expressed its desire to join the BRICS group of major emerging economies, which accounts for 35% of global economic output, as a means to strengthen emerging countries, its foreign ministry said in a statement.
articles.title: Indonesia wants to join BRICS, ministry says

articles.author: Gloria Dickie
articles.description: Current climate policies will result in global warming of more than 3 degrees Celsius (5.4 degrees Fahrenheit) by the end of the century, according to a United Nations report on Thursday, more than twice the rise agreed to nearly a decade ago.
articles.title: Climate set to warm by 3.1 C without greater action, UN report warns

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Al-Mayadeen, a pro-Iranian broadcaster, said early on Friday that an Israeli strike on Hasbaya in southern Lebanon killed one of its cameramen.
articles.title: Broadcaster Al-Mayadeen says cameraman killed in Israeli strike on southern Lebanon
